1.transliteration:
dhrtarastra uvaca
dharma-ksetre kuru-ksetre samaveta yuyutsavah
mamakah pandavas caiva kim akurvata sanjaya
1.translation:
Dhrtarastra said:
O Sanjaya, what did the sons of Pandu and mine do when they gathered on
the sacred plain of Kuruksetra, eager for battle?

2.transliteration:
sanjaya uvaca
drstva tu pandavanikam vyudham duryodhanas tada
acaryam upasangamya raja vacanam abravit
2.translation:
Sanjaya said: Having seen the army of the Pandavas ranged for battle,
Prince Duryodhana went up to his acarya (teacher), Drona, and said:

3.transliteration:
pasyaitam pandu-putranam acarya mahatim camum
vyudham drupada-putrena tava sisyena dhimata
3.translation:
Look, O Teacher, at this mighty army of the sons of Pandu, which has been
positioned by your talented pupil, the son of Drupada.

4.transliteration:
atra sura mahesv-asa bhimarjuna-sama yudhi
yuyudhano viratas ca drupadas ca maha-rathah
4.translation:
There are in it heroes, mighty archers, equal in battle to Bhima and
Arjuna: Yuyudhana, Virata, and the great warrior (mahdratha) Drupada,

5.transliteration:
dhrstaketus cekitanah kasirajas ca viryavan
purujit kuntibhojas ca saibyas ca nara-pungavah
5.translation:
Dhrishtaketu, Cekitana, and the valiant king of Kasi, Purujit, Kuntibhoja,
and the prominent man Saibya,

6.transliteration:
yudhamanyus ca vikranta uttamaujas ca viryavan
saubhadro draupadeyas ca sarva eva maha-rathah
6.translation:
The heroic Yudhamanyu, and the valiant Uttamauja; the son of Subhadra
and the son of Draupadi, all proficient charioteers.

7.transliteration:
asmakam tu visista ye tan nibodha dvijottama
nayaka mama sainyasya samjnartham tan bravimi te
7.translation:
I now mention, O best of the twice-born, who are the most distinguished
among us, the commanders of my army, naming to you by way of example.

8.transliteration:
bhavan bhismas ca karnas ca krpas ca samitim-jayah
asvatthama vikarnas ca saumadattis tathaiva ca
8.translation:
Yourself and Bhisma, Kama, the victorious Krpa, Asvatthama and
Vikarna, also Jayadratta, the son of Somadatta;

9.transliteration:
anye ca bahavah sura mad-arthe tyakta-jivitah
nana-sastra-praharanah sarve yuddha-visaradah
9.translation:
And, many other heroes giving up their lives for me, fighting with various
weapons, and all well skilled in the art of warfare.

10.transliteration:
aparyaptam tad asmakam balam bhismabhiraksitam
paryaptam tv idam etesam balam bhimabhiraksitam
10.translation:
This army of ours, commanded by Bhisma is unbeatable, whereas that
army of theirs which is under the protection of Bhima is inadequate.

11.transliteration:
ayanesu ca sarvesu yatha-bhagam avasthitah
bhismam evabhiraksantu bhavantah sarva eva hi
11.translation:
Therefore, now, do all of you, occupying your respective positions in the
various divisions of the army, defend Bhisma only.

12.transliteration:
tasya sanjanayan harsam kuru-vrddhah pitamahah
simha-nadam vinadyoccaih sankham dadhmau pratapavan
12.translation:
The powerful grandsire Bhisma, the eldest of the Kuru reign, in order to
cheer him (Duryodhana), roared as a lion and blew his conch.

13.transliteration:
tatah sankhas ca bheryas ca panavanaka-gomukhah
sahasaivabhyahanyanta sa sabdas tumulo 'bhavat
13.translation:
At this, and all at once, conches, kettledrums, cymbals, drums and horns
were heard, and the sound of that was uncontrolled.

14.transliteration:
tatah svetair hay air yukta mahati syandane sthitau
madhavah pandavas caiva divyau sankhau pradadhmatuh
14.translation:
Then, Madhava (Krsna) and the son of Pandu (Arjuna), who were seated in
their grand chariot yoked to white horses, blew their divine conches.

15.transliteration:
pancajanyam hrsikeso devadattam dhananjayah
paundram dadhmau maha-sankham bhima-karma vrkodarah
15.translation:
Hrsikesa (Krsna) blew the conch Pancajanya; and Dhananjaya (Arjuna, the
winner of wealth) blew his conch Devadatta. Bhima, the performer of
terrible deeds, blew his great conch Paundra.

16.transliteration:
anantavijayam raja kunti-putro yudhisthirah
nakulah sahadevas ca sughosa-manipuspakau
16.translation:
King Yudhisthira, the son of Kunti (Arjuna), blew his Anantavyaya, while
Nakula and Sahadeva blew the Sughosa and the Manipuspaka conches.

17.transliteration:
kasyas ca paramesv-asah sikhandi ca maha-rathah
dhrstadyumno viratas ca satyakis caparajitah
17.translation:
The king of Kasi, an excellent archer; Sikhandi, the great chariot-warrior,
Dhrstadyumna, Virata, and the unconquerable Satyaki;

18.transliteration:
drupado draupadeyas ca sarvasah prthivi-pate
saubhadras ca maha-bahuh sankhan dadhmuh prthak prthak
18.translation:
Drupada and the sons of Draupadi, O Lord of the Earth, and the mighty-
armed son of Subhadra, all individually in one accord blew their respective
conches.

19.transliteration:
sa ghoso dhartarastranam hrdayani vyadarayat
nabhas caprthivim caiva tumulo bh/vyanunadayan
19.translation:
The tumultuous uproar tore the hearts of the sons (people) of
Dhrtarashtra's assembly, filling the earth and sky with sound.
19.Ramanuja commentary: Duryodhana, after personally reviewing the forces of Pandavas marshalled by Bhima, and his own army marshalled by Bhishma, turned to Drona his teacher, and expressed his concern that his own army would be inadequate to conquer the Pandava forces â€” he was grief-stricken. Observing Duryodhana's loss of confidence, Bhishma, in order to encourage him, roared like a lion, and then blowing his conch, made his army sound their conches and kettle-drums, which made an uproar as a sign of their confidence of victory.

20.transliteration:
atha vyavasthitan drstva dhartarastran kapi dvajah
pravrtte sastra-sampate dhanur udyamya pandavah
hrsikesam tada vakyam idam aha mahi-pate
20.translation:
Then, looking at the sons of Dhritarashtra standing ranged for battle, while
the discharge of missiles began, Arjuna, the son of Pandu, whose emblem
depicts Maruki (a monkey) , took up his bow and spoke these words to
Hrslkesa (Krsna), O Lord of Earth:

21.transliteration:
arjuna uvaca
senayor ubhayor madhye ratham sthapaya me 'cyuta
yavad etan nirikse 'ham yod dhu-kaman avasthitan
kair may a saha yoddhavyam asmin rana-samudyame
21.translation:
Arjuna said: O Acyuta (Immortal, Krsna), position my chariot between the
two armies, that I may just see those who stand here desirous to fight, to
know with whom I must combat in this act of war.

22.transliteration:
arjuna uvaca
senayor ubhayor madhye ratham sthapaya me 'cyuta
yavad etan nirikse 'ham yod dhu-kaman avasthitan
kair may a saha yoddhavyam asmin rana-samudyame
22.translation:
Arjuna said: O Acyuta (Immortal, Krsna), position my chariot between the
two armies, that I may just see those who stand here desirous to fight, to
know with whom I must combat in this act of war.

23.transliteration:
yotsyamanan avekse 'ham ya ete 'tra samagatah
dhartarastrasya durbuddher yuddhe priya-cikirsavah
23.translation:
I wish to look upon those who are assembled here, and are about to engage
in battle eager to service in conflict the evil-minded son of Dhritarashtra,
achieving what he regards as best.

24.transliteration:
sanjaya uvaca
evam ukto hrsikeso gudakesena bharata
senayor ubhayor madhye sthapayitva rathottamam
24.translation:
Sanjaya said: In response to Gudakesa's (Arjuna) request, O Bharata
(Dhrtardshtra), Hrslkesa stationed that finest among chariots between the
two armies.

25.transliteration:
bhisma-drona-pramukhatah sarvesam ca mahi-ksitam
uvaca partha pasyaitan samavetan kurun iti
25.translation:
Confronting Bhisma and Drona and all the rulers of earth, he said: O
Partha (Arjuna), look at these assembled Kurus.

26.transliteration:
tatrapasyat sthitan parthah pitrn atha pitamahan
acaryan matulan bhratrn putran pautran sakhims tatha
svasuran suhrdas caiva nayor ubhayor api
26.translation:
Then, the son of Partha (Arjuna) saw ranged there in both the armies
fathers (paternal uncles), grandfathers, teachers, maternal uncles, brothers,
sons, grandsons and comrades, father-in-laws and friends.

27.transliteration:
tan samiksya sa kaunteyah sarvan bandhun avasthitan
krpaya parayavisto visidann idam abravit
27.translation:
When the son of Kunti (Arjuna) saw that all those standing there in the
ranks of the two armies were his kinsmen, he was overwhelmed with
deepest pity and consequently said in sorrow:

28.transliteration:
arjuna uvaca
drstvemam sva janam krsna yuyutsum samupasthitam
sidanti mama gatrani mukham ca parisusyati
28.translation:
Arjuna said: Seeing these kinsmen, O Krsna, ranged, eager for combat, my
limbs fail, and my mouth is dried up,

29.transliteration:
vepathus ca sarire me roma harsas ca jayate
gandivam sramsate hastat tvak caiva paridahyate
29.translation:
My body quivers and my hair stands on end.
The Gandlva (bow) slips from my hand, and my skin is terribly burning.

30.transliteration:
na ca saknomy avasthatum bhramativa ca me manah
nimittani ca pasyami viparitani kesava
30.translation:
I am not able to stand, and my mind is spiralling as it were.
I see opposing omens, O Kesava (Krsna),

31.transliteration:
na ca sreyo 'nupasyami hatva sva-janam ahave
na kankse vijayam krsna na ca rajyam sukhani ca
31.translation:
and do not see any good from
killing my kinsmen in battle. I do not wish victory, O Krsna, nor kingdoms or pleasures. What is the use
to us in having a kingdom, O Govinda (Krsna), or amusement and even life.

32.transliteration:
kim no rajyena govinda kim bhogair jivitena va
yesam arthe kanksitam no rajyam bhogah sukhani ca
32.translation:
Those for whose sake we desire kingdom, enjoyments and pleasures stand
here for battle, having abandoned life and wealth;

33.transliteration:
ta ime 'vasthita yuddhe pranams tyaktva dhanani ca
acaryah pitarah putras tathaiva ca pitamahah
33.translation:
Teachers, fathers (paternal uncles), sons and grandfathers, maternal uncles,
fathers-in-law, grandsons, brothers-in-law and also (other) relatives.

34.transliteration:
matulah svasurah pautrah syalah sambandhinas tatha
etan na hantum icchami ghnato 'pi madhusudana
34.translation: These, I do not want to kill, O Slayer of Madhusudana (Krsna), though they want to kill us, even for the sake to obtain the primacy over the three worlds; and much less for the sake of the earth!

35.transliteration:
api trailokya-rajyasya hetoh kim nu mahi-krte
nihatya dhartarastran nah ka pritih syaj janardana
35.translation: Killing these sons of Dhrtarashtra, what satisfaction can be ours, O Janardana (Maintainer of the people, Krsna)? On killing these offenders only sin will take hold of us.

36.transliteration:
papam evasrayed asman hatvaitan atatayinah
tasman narha vayam hantum dhartarastran sa bandhavan
sva janam hi katham hatva sukhinah syama madhava
36.translation: It is not correct to kill our own kinsmen, the sons of Dhrtarashtra, indeed, by killing our own people, how can we be happy, O Madhava (Krsna)?

37.transliteration:
yady apy ete na pasyanti lobhopahata-cetasah
kula-ksaya-krtam dosam mitra-drohe ca patakam
37.translation: Although these, their minds overpowered by greediness, perceive no guilt in the extinction of the family and no sin in treachery to friends,

38.transliteration:
katham na jneyam asmabhih papad asman nivartitum
kula ksaya krtam dosam prapasyadbhir janardana
38.translation: Yet, O Janardana (Krsna); why should we not learn to retreat from this sin, perceiving the guilt in the destruction of the family?

39.transliteration:
kula-ksaye pranasyanti kula-dharmah sanatanah
dharme naste kulam krtsnam adharmo 'bhibhavaty uta
39.translation: In the annihilation of a family, the immemorial family traditions (dharmas) are destroyed, and when these disappear, lawlessness overtakes the whole family.

40.transliteration:
adharmabhibhavat krsna pradusyanti kula striyah
sttisu dustasu varsneya jayate varna-sankarah
40.translation: When lawlessness prevails, O Krsna, the women of the family become corrupted; and when women grow corrupt, O descendant of Varsneya (Krsna), there will be caste-confusion;

41.transliteration:
sankaro narakayaiva kula-ghnanam kulasya ca
patanti pitaro hy esam lupta-pindodaka-kriyah
41.translation: And, the confusion of castes leads the family and those who have destroyed the families to hell. Their forefathers fall as well (to hell), deprived of their ritual offerings of rice-balls and water.

42.transliteration:
dosair etaih kula-ghnanam varna-sankara-karakaih
utsadyante jati-dharmah kula-dharmas ca sasvatah
42.translation: By these evil deeds of those destroying the family, causing the fusion of castes (varna-samkara), the eternal family traditions are devastated.

43.transliteration:
utsanna-kula-dharmanam manusyanam janardana
narake niyatam vaso bhavatity anususruma
43.translation: We have heard, O Janardana (Krsna), that those whose family traditions have been ruined dwell necessarily in hell.

44.transliteration:
aho bata mahat papam kartum vyavasita vayam
yad rajya-sukha-lobhena hantum sva-janam udyatah
44.translation: Alas! We have determined to commit a great sin, inasmuch as we are attempting to kill our own kinsmen through greediness for the pleasures of supremacy.

45.transliteration:
yadi mam apratikaram asastram sastra-panayah
dhartarastra rane hanyus tan me ksemataram bhavet
45.translation: It would be better for me, if the sons of Dhrtarashtra, weapons in hand, were to slay me in combat, while being unarmed and unable to resist.

46.transliteration:
sanjaya uvaca
evam uktvarjunah sankhye rathopastha upavisat
visrjya sa-saram capam soka-samvigna-manasah
46.translation: Having spoken as such, Arjuna sank down on the seat of his chariot, casting away his bow and arrow, his mind distracted with grief.
